item.title: Green Party Defeats Labour in U.K. Special Election, in Blow to Starmer
item.content:encoded: The result marks the first time the Greens have won a British parliamentary by-election and signals the frustration of left-leaning voters with Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

item.title: Germany’s Oil and Gas Output Is Dwindling as Prices Rise
item.content:encoded: Natural gas production in Germany has fallen about 80 percent in the past two decades even as the country seeks to replace flows from Russia.

item.title: Hungary Plays Spoiler in Europe as Orban Strains for Votes at Home
item.content:encoded: Facing a serious election challenge, Prime Minister Viktor Orban is holding up a big E.U. loan for Ukraine. Analysts say the timing is no coincidence.

item.title: The Many Shades of Complicity in the Epstein Files Fallout
item.content:encoded: Philosophers have long wrestled with what to do about the onlookers and profiteers surrounding those who have done terrible things.

item.title: E.U. Pushes Ahead With South American Trade Deal Despite Legal Challenge
item.content:encoded: The provisional application of the agreement with Brazil, Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay is intended to diversify Europe’s trading relationships.

item.title: E.U. Pushes Ahead With South American Trade Deal Despite Legal Challenge
item.content:encoded: The provisional application of the agreement with Brazil, Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay is intended to diversify Europe’s trading relationships.

item.title: Trump’s Foreign Policy: Resurrecting Empire
item.content:encoded: President Trump’s approach is a revival of the mission of empire — acquiring the territories and resources of sovereign peoples.

item.title: OpenAI Raises $110 Billion Led by Amazon, Nvidia and SoftBank, Extending A.I. Boom
item.content:encoded: Amazon, Nvidia and SoftBank led the investment, valuing the parent of ChatGPT at $730 billion.

item.title: OpenAI Raises $110 Billion Led by Amazon, Nvidia and SoftBank, Extending A.I. Boom
item.content:encoded: Amazon, Nvidia and SoftBank led the investment, valuing the parent of ChatGPT at $730 billion.

item.title: Pakistan Strikes Afghanistan in ‘Open War’ Against Taliban Regime
item.content:encoded: The airstrikes came hours after Afghan troops had attacked Pakistani border positions and follow months of worsening relations between the neighboring countries.

item.title: How India Became One of the World’s Biggest Economies
item.content:encoded: India has grown rapidly despite its slow industrialization, and its economy is now nearly as big as Japan’s.

item.title: How India Became One of the World’s Biggest Economies
item.content:encoded: India has grown rapidly despite its slow industrialization, and its economy is now nearly as big as Japan’s.

item.title: 4 Takeaways About the U.S. Birthrate Decline
item.content:encoded: There is good news buried behind the worries about population decline, some experts say.

item.title: What Both Anthropic and the Pentagon Get Wrong
item.content:encoded: Neither Anthropic nor the Pentagon are thinking about this issue in a meaningful way.

item.title: Why Are Pakistan and Afghanistan Fighting?
item.content:encoded: The renewed violence between the neighboring countries stems from Pakistan’s accusations that Afghanistan’s Taliban government has harbored a militant group.

item.title: Israel Facing Prospect of War With a Depleted Missile Defense
item.content:encoded: The June 2025 conflict with Iran depleted Israeli and U.S. stocks of antiballistic missiles. If there is another war, the pressure will be on to destroy Iranian missiles before they can be launched.

item.title: Pentagon Fires Another Laser at a Drone, Prompting a New Air Closure
item.content:encoded: After the downing of a Customs and Border Protection drone, the F.A.A. closed the airspace above Fort Hancock, Texas.

item.title: The I.R.S. Shut Its Direct File, but Here Are Other Free Filing Options
item.content:encoded: The agency still offers a Free File program that works with commercial tax software firms. Some companies also offer free tools for certain filers.

item.title: Hillary Clinton Denies Knowing Epstein or His Crimes in a Tense Deposition
item.content:encoded: After resisting testifying for months, the former secretary of state entered the session defiant, and grew irate after a Republican leaked a photo from inside the room.

item.title: Anthropic Says It Cannot ‘Accede’ to Pentagon in Talks Over A.I.
item.content:encoded: Anthropic said it was standing firm on not having its A.I. used in certain scenarios by the Pentagon, which has imposed a Friday deadline on the company to give unfettered access to its technology.

item.title: Paramount Is Set to Win Warner Bros. Now Comes the Hard Part.
item.content:encoded: The media company controlled by the Ellisons out-dueled Netflix for control of Warner Bros. Discovery. The next step is making the combined media empires work.

item.title: The Plunging Birthrate
item.content:encoded: We asked women about their views on having kids.

item.title: With Possible Iran Strike Looming, U.S. Says Staff Can Leave Israel, and Urges Speed
item.content:encoded: In an email to embassy workers Friday morning, Ambassador Mike Huckabee warned them that if they wanted to leave Israel, they “should do so TODAY.”

item.title: He Hopes to Turn the Island of Nevis Into a Libertarian Paradise, With Crypto
item.content:encoded: A Bitcoin baron wants to build a libertarian paradise on the island of Nevis. Democracy is getting in the way.

item.title: The Clintons’ Epstein Testimony, and the Pentagon’s New Laser Strike
item.content:encoded: Plus, the company that just cut 4,000 jobs because of A.I.

item.title: South Korea Clears Way for Google Maps to Fully Operate
item.content:encoded: South Korea approved Google’s request to export detailed map data, reversing a longstanding restriction that made the tool largely nonfunctional.

item.title: For CNN, a Takeover by Paramount Means a Suddenly Uncertain Future
item.content:encoded: Paramount’s apparent victory over Netflix in securing Warner Bros. Discovery has led to concerns within the CNN newsroom.

item.title: For CNN, a Takeover by Paramount Means a Suddenly Uncertain Future
item.content:encoded: Paramount’s apparent victory over Netflix in securing Warner Bros. Discovery has led to concerns within the CNN newsroom.

item.title: What Larry and David Ellison Would Own After Warner Bros. Takeover
item.content:encoded: If Paramount can close its deal to buy Warner Bros. Discovery, Larry and David Ellison will influence nearly every corner of news, entertainment and tech.

item.title: What Larry and David Ellison Would Own After Warner Bros. Takeover
item.content:encoded: If Paramount can close its deal to buy Warner Bros. Discovery, Larry and David Ellison will influence nearly every corner of news, entertainment and tech.

item.title: Chris Fleming Uses Dance to Make Us Laugh in His HBO Special
item.content:encoded: The kind of performer other stand-ups rave about, Chris Fleming turns to choreography to land jokes in his new HBO special.

item.title: A World Where All Is Free? That’s Elon Musk’s Theory of ‘Sustainable Abundance.’
item.content:encoded: The Tesla and SpaceX chief has told his followers that they will live in a world where robots will take care of every need and people do not have to work, in what has become his latest slogan.

item.title: A World Where All Is Free? That’s Elon Musk’s Theory of ‘Sustainable Abundance.’
item.content:encoded: The Tesla and SpaceX chief has told his followers that they will live in a world where robots will take care of every need and people do not have to work, in what has become his latest slogan.

item.title: The Web of Companies Owned by Elon Musk
item.content:encoded: In mapping out Elon Musk’s wealth, our investigation found that Mr. Musk is behind more than 90 companies in Texas. Kirsten Grind, a New York Times Investigations reporter, explains what her team found.

item.title: The Rise and Fall of a 3-D Printing Empire
item.content:encoded: Desktop Metal, a billion-dollar start-up, promised to revolutionize manufacturing. It went bankrupt, and now has much humbler ambitions as the 3-D printing industry takes a sober turn.

item.title: Elon Musk’s Secret Web of Companies in Texas
item.content:encoded: The megabillionaire was tied to about 90 companies in the state, which he uses for everything from paying nannies to buying land to supporting Donald Trump’s re-election, according to a Times examination.

item.title: Elon Musk’s Secret Web of Companies in Texas
item.content:encoded: The megabillionaire was tied to about 90 companies in the state, which he uses for everything from paying nannies to buying land to supporting Donald Trump’s re-election, according to a Times examination.

item.title: U.S. Birthrate Declines to an All-Time Low, but There’s a Story of Success
item.content:encoded: The political class is worried about the historic drop. But the biggest change is among the youngest women, who are the least ready to have children.

item.title: Honolulu on a Budget
item.content:encoded: Hawaii is expensive, but basing yourself in the capital, where local culture and nature are within easy reach, can save you money on lodgings and food, leaving funds for a few splurges.

item.title: How a Close Associate of Epstein’s Found Career Redemption in Japan
item.content:encoded: Top Japanese officials are backing a tech and entrepreneurship initiative led in part by Joichi Ito, whose involvement with Jeffrey Epstein may endanger efforts to get the project off the ground.

item.title: Late Night Lampoons Trump’s State of the Union Ratings
item.content:encoded: Stephen Colbert joked that the president “is really dragging down broadcast television” with lower ratings for Tuesday’s State of the Union than last year’s address.

item.title: Trump’s Shields Are Down
item.content:encoded: Personnel once meant policy; now it means flattery.

item.title: India Built the World’s Back Office. A.I. Is Starting to Shrink It.
item.content:encoded: Artificial intelligence promises to automate the white-collar work that made India a tech powerhouse. The country is racing to adapt before it’s too late.

item.title: With a New Nigeria Refinery, Africa’s Richest Man Wants ‘to Rescue the Country’
item.content:encoded: Aliko Dangote, Africa’s richest man, has an ambitious vision for the continent’s most populous nation, but hurdles stand in his way.

item.title: India Built the World’s Back Office. A.I. Is Starting to Shrink It.
item.content:encoded: Artificial intelligence promises to automate the white-collar work that made India a tech powerhouse. The country is racing to adapt before it’s too late.

item.title: Netflix Backs Out of Bid for Warner Bros., Paving Way for Paramount Takeover
item.content:encoded: The move was a stunning development in the long-running corporate battle for the storied media giant.

item.title: Netflix Backs Out of Bid for Warner Bros., Paving Way for Paramount Takeover
item.content:encoded: The move was a stunning development in the long-running corporate battle for the storied media giant.

item.title: Fact-check: In Trump’s Case for an Attack on Iran, False or Unproven Claims
item.content:encoded: Key elements of the Trump administration’s arguments this week for another military campaign against Iran do not hold up.

item.title: Federal Judge Accuses Trump Administration of Repeatedly Disobeying Orders
item.content:encoded: The federal judge identified 210 orders issued in 143 cases in Minnesota in which he said Immigration and Customs Enforcement officials had not complied with court orders.

item.title: Block Cuts 40% of Its Work Force Because of Its Embrace of A.I.
item.content:encoded: About 4,000 workers will lose their jobs as the payments company does more work with new artificial intelligence tools, its top executive said.

item.title: New A.C.A. Plans Could Increase Family Deductibles to $31,000
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is proposing Obamacare plans that it says will lower health insurance premiums. But critics warn they would make care unaffordable.

item.title: 32.6 Million Watched Trump’s State of the Union Address, Nielsen Says
item.content:encoded: The audience was roughly on par with former President Biden’s final State of the Union address in 2024.

item.title: Trump Declared Victory in Minneapolis. But What Did He Accomplish?
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration came under fire for an operation that turned lethal and politically toxic. But the show of force may also have had a bigger purpose: to serve as a warning.

item.title: Justice Department Exposed Cooperating Witnesses in Epstein Files
item.content:encoded: The disclosure is the latest example of how the urgent push to release the files led to the government publicizing information it would normally keep under wraps.

item.title: Why Estrogen Patches For Menopause Are So Hard to Find
item.content:encoded: Changing attitudes around menopause treatment have driven up demand for hormone therapy.

item.title: Why Estrogen Patches For Menopause Are So Hard to Find
item.content:encoded: Changing attitudes around menopause treatment have driven up demand for hormone therapy.

item.title: U.S. Mortgage Rates Fall Below 6% for First Time in Years
item.content:encoded: The evidence is patchy on whether lower rates have meaningfully spurred more activity, as the Trump administration floats measures it says will make housing more affordable.

item.title: World Economic Forum Chief Resigns Over Epstein Ties
item.content:encoded: Borge Brende, a former foreign minister of Norway, had maintained contact with the convicted sex offender.

item.title: Oliver Grant, a Business Architect of the Wu-Tang Clan, Dies
item.content:encoded: He was behind the scenes with Wu-Tang Clan, the New York rap group, since its founding and helped expand its reach with a fashion line.

item.title: FedEx Says It Could Return Tariff Refunds to Customers
item.content:encoded: The company sued the administration days after the Supreme Court ruled against the president’s duties.

item.title: For America’s 250th, Should the Coin of Trump’s Realm Be Gold?
item.content:encoded: A federally appointed committee is pushing back on plans to mint gold currency depicting President Trump.

item.title: Z? Zo? Mam? Mayor Zohran Mamdani is a Man of Many Nicknames.
item.content:encoded: Mayor Zohran Mamdani has been given a bevy of nicknames by New York City’s tabloid newspapers and political class. Which will stick?

item.title: They Helped Women Fight Online Abuse. They Were Barred From the U.S.
item.content:encoded: The founders of HateAid, a German human-rights group that helps victims of online attacks, were accused by the Trump administration of being part of a “global censorship-industrial complex.”

item.title: Kalshi Accuses a ‘MrBeast’ Employee of Insider Trading
item.content:encoded: The prediction-market platform said it had reported the employee to federal regulators. The show’s parent company said it had “no tolerance for this behavior.”

item.title: ‘Fast Car’ Changed Luke Combs’s Life. He’s Back for More Hits.
item.content:encoded: The country singer helped to usher the genre into the streaming era before taking a step back. On his new album, he wants to go for broke.

item.title: Why Nvidia’s Big Profits Aren’t Lifting Markets
item.content:encoded: The chip giant at the center of the artificial intelligence boom again beat expectations. But it didn’t overcome investor jitters.

item.title: Revel, a Maker of Software for Running Hardware, Raises $150 Million
item.content:encoded: The start-up, founded by a former top SpaceX engineer, promises to help companies reduce their testing times and optimize systems.

item.title: A.I. Dating Apps Complicate China’s Efforts to Boost Birthrate
item.content:encoded: As China grapples with a shrinking population and historically low birthrate, people are finding romance with chatbots instead.

item.title: Bleak Research Report Stokes A.I. Debate on Wall St.
item.content:encoded: In a widely circulated note, Citrini Research painted a dire picture of job losses and stock market sell-offs, though many analysts and economists questioned its conclusions.

item.title: Trump Proposed a New Retirement Plan for With Up to a $1,000 Match. What to Know.
item.content:encoded: An existing law could help create new retirement savings plans for people who lack them. But there may be income restrictions on any match.

item.title: Businesses Push for Tariff Refunds as Trump Aides Hint at Fight to Come
item.content:encoded: By the president’s own admission, it could be years before the matter is settled, even though the administration previously indicated it would pay.

item.title: Blaming Tariffs, Aston Martin Will Trim 20% of Its Work Force
item.content:encoded: The luxury automaker said losses for 2025 had increased from the year before, as tariffs and geopolitical uncertainty took a toll on its operations.

item.title: Abu Dhabi’s State Oil Company Looks Beyond Oil
item.content:encoded: Having reshaped the company, Sultan Ahmed Al Jaber wants to expand internationally, particularly in natural gas, chemicals and renewables.

item.title: What Trump Did (and Didn’t) Say in the State of the Union Speech
item.content:encoded: The president boasted about a strong economy in his State of the Union address. But he spent less time on a potential weakness, affordability.

item.title: From the French Riviera to Kyoto, Japan, 5 New Luxury Hotels
item.content:encoded: From palatial to contemporary to luxuriously rustic, this collection of new resorts and inns offers spas, private gardens, fine restaurants and exquisite settings.

item.title: Pentagon Gives Anthropic an Ultimatum Over the Company’s A.I. Model
item.content:encoded: Anthropic insists on limits on how its technology is used and could be labeled a supply chain risk if it fails to accept the military’s demands.

item.title: Court Rules Against Justice Dept. Search of Reporter’s Computers
item.content:encoded: The judge said the court itself would search the devices, which were seized from a Washington Post reporter’s home last month.

item.title: Paramount Raises Its Bid for Warner Bros. Discovery
item.content:encoded: Warner Bros. Discovery said Paramount’s new offer of $31 a share could lead to a “superior proposal” to the deal it signed with Netflix.

item.title: Senator Blumenthal Opens Inquiry Into Iran Transactions on Binance
item.content:encoded: Senator Richard Blumenthal of Connecticut sent a letter to Binance asking about the flow of $1.7 billion from accounts on the crypto exchange to Iranian entities.

item.title: Wayve, an A.I. Driverless Car Start-Up in Europe, Raises $1.2 Billion
item.content:encoded: The London-based company is building a system that uses artificial intelligence to power autonomous vehicles.

item.title: Averted Midair Collision Shows Importance of Air Safety Act, Backers Say
item.content:encoded: The legislation’s advocates say a close call between two private planes near Teterboro, N.J., on Feb. 13 underscored how collision prevention technology could save lives.

item.title: House Narrowly Rejects Air Safety Bill After Pentagon Opposition
item.content:encoded: A move to swiftly pass the bill failed by a single vote. It would have required aircraft to carry technology that officials said might have prevented a midair collision near Washington last year.

item.title: Home Depot Says Homeowners Are Weary From Economic Pressures
item.content:encoded: The retailer said same-store sales were nearly flat as homeowners shied away from big-ticket projects amid worries about housing costs and the job market.
